title: What is AI?
content: AI is pattern recognition at scale. Math plus data plus computing power. Pattern matching that recognizes cats, spam, faces.

title: AI vs Machine Learning vs Deep Learning
content: Russian doll analogy. AI is the big umbrella. Machine Learning improves from data. Deep Learning uses neural networks.

title: How Machines Learn
content: Supervised learning with labeled data. Unsupervised learning finds patterns. Reinforcement learning learns from rewards.

title: Garbage In Garbage Out
content: Data quality is everything. Your AI is only as good as your data. Bias in data leads to bias in predictions.

title: Deep Learning & Neural Networks
content: Neural networks with multiple layers. CNNs for images. RNNs for sequences. Transformers revolutionized NLP.

title: Multimodal AI
content: AI that handles text, images, audio, video. Vision language models. GPT-4V, Gemini, Claude can see and describe images.

title: RAG - Retrieval Augmented Generation
content: Giving AI access to external knowledge. Vector databases store embeddings. Reduces hallucinations with grounded answers.

title: Small Language Models
content: Smaller models like Phi, Mistral, Llama. Run on device. Lower cost, faster inference, privacy benefits.

title: What is Generative AI?
content: AI that creates new content. Text, images, code, music. Prediction on steroids. The first draft costs zero.

title: Large Language Models (LLMs)
content: GPT, Claude, Gemini, Llama. Trained on internet text. Predict next token. Billions of parameters.

title: Tokens and Context Windows
content: Tokens are word pieces. Context window is memory limit. 128K tokens means longer conversations. Token pricing affects cost.

title: Prompt Engineering
content: How you ask matters. System prompts set behavior. Few-shot examples guide output. Chain of thought for reasoning.

title: Temperature and Sampling
content: Temperature controls randomness. Low temperature for facts. High temperature for creativity. Top-p nucleus sampling.

title: Fine-tuning LLMs
content: Customize models for specific tasks. LoRA for efficient training. Domain adaptation. Instruction tuning.

title: From Chatbots to Agents
content: Chatbots talk, agents do. Goal-following vs recipe-following. Agents take actions autonomously.

title: How Agents Work
content: The agent loop: perceive, think, act, observe. Four components: brain, tools, memory, planning.

title: Tools - The Agent's Hands
content: Function calling. API integrations. Computer use for browser automation. MCP protocol for tool connections.

title: Agent Memory Systems
content: Short-term memory in context. Long-term memory with vector databases. Episodic and semantic memory.

title: Agentic Design Patterns
content: Reflection for self-checking. ReAct for reasoning and acting. Multi-agent collaboration and orchestration.

title: Multi-Agent Systems
content: Multiple agents working together. Specialized roles. Debate and consensus. CrewAI, AutoGen frameworks.

title: Running Models Locally
content: Ollama for local inference. LM Studio GUI. Privacy and offline use. Quantization for smaller models.

title: Agent Frameworks
content: LangChain, LangGraph for building agents. CrewAI for multi-agent. Semantic Kernel from Microsoft.

title: Prediction vs Judgment
content: AI lowers the cost of prediction. Humans still own judgment. Strategic decisions need human oversight.

title: Comparing LLM Models
content: OpenAI GPT-4, Anthropic Claude, Google Gemini, Meta Llama. Benchmarks like MMLU, HumanEval. Pricing comparison.

title: Reasoning Models
content: o1, o3 models that think step by step. Test-time compute. Chain of thought reasoning. Better at math and logic.

title: Computer Use
content: AI that controls mouse and keyboard. Browser automation. Vision-based interaction. OpenAI Operator, Claude computer use.
